title: Sarah Farnsworth Hatch
text:
Hello! I am a third-year PhD student at Harvard Graduate School of Education.
I study what we can do (programs, interventions) to help kids thrive, especially before they start to experience social, emotional, academic, or behavioral problems. I am trained by applied developmental psychologists with a focus on prevention and implementation science.
I use both quantitative and qualitative methods to address pressing issues in
Because of the current political climate, I have increasingly focused on political barriers to implementing programs which support children’s wellbeing. My current work is centered around the parents’ rights movement in education through both descriptive and experimental work. I am actively leading two studies which examine conservative opposition to social and emotional learning and the proclivity to censor schooling materials based on political affiliation.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.
